title: GrubHub stock tanks after earnings show disappointing sales, forecast
text: GrubHub Inc. GRUB, -1.07% shares fell nearly 20% in late trading Monday after the online food-delivery company reported disappointing sales and expectations. The company reported third-quarter profit of $1 million, or a penny a share, on sales of $322.1 million, up from $247.2 million in the same quarter a year ago. After adjusting for stock-based compensation and other factors, GrubHub claimed earnings of 27 cents a share, down from 45 cents a share a year ago. Analysts on average were expecting GrubHub to report adjusted earnings or 27 cents a share on revenue of $330 million, according to FactSet. For the holiday quarter, GrubHub forecast for little to no sequential growth, projecting revenue of $315 million to $335 million, while analysts on average were expecting sales of $387 million. GrubHub stock has already declined 24% so far this year, as the S&P 500 index has gained 20.6%.
